bibl.title: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1953

div1.p: Rojas informs Hench that he can receive the medal anytime he comes to Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1953
div1.opener:
QUINTA SAN JOSE
REDENCION
MARIANAO-CUBA
November 20, 1953
Dr. Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We received your nice letter and have
not answered waiting to get the news papers you went.
But I do not want to delay this letter any longer and
will send them as soon as I get them.

I hope by this time you have already
received the official comunication and Mrs. Smith's
letter telling about the Nutrition Week...

We have find out that they can give you
the medal any time you come to Havana, because on a
special privete ceremony, because the special date
is passed, so it will be all right if you come for Mrs.
Smith meeting, and the same with the Finlay's.

I hope you can understand this letter,
my english is every day a little worst.
